Articles.Content:
Well, I got a total shock this morning.

I've been working on my first plane design in KSP. I was trying to keep it simple, and I definitely borrowed some elements from work. I imagine when I am more practiced I will try to build a Hondajet in game sometime. However, here is my first flyable plane. it handles ok, but has some overmaneuverability. You also have to trim the nose up about 15Ã‚Â°

[![Efj63nJ.png](http://i.imgur.com/Efj63nJ.png)](http://imgur.com/Efj63nJ)

So, this morning, my 10 year old daughter comes to me and asks if she can make a plane. I give her the basic rundown about CoL being just behind CoM, and show her how the hangar works. I reminded her when she thought she was done that she needs control surfaces to steer, suggested she add winglets to correct her yaw issue, and mounted her landing gear on the big radial decouple to give her tail enough height to not bang the ground on rotation. The rest was all her.

[![EHTqx4x.png](http://i.imgur.com/EHTqx4x.png)](http://imgur.com/EHTqx4x)

It flies like a dream. You have to rotate slowly, or it tail-bumps, and you only need to trim the nose up a hair. You need to fly it with caps-lock, but it's much smoother than my attempt.

Try it out, if you want.

[http://www./download/a22t2v4049vin4c/lenderman%27s+test+flight.craft](http://www./download/a22t2v4049vin4c/lenderman%27s+test+flight.craft)
Look at you go, raising up the next generation of nerds. Yer doin good, dude ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
